references.formattedCitation: Liddle, Aidan, and Flavius Arrianus. Periplus Ponti Euxini. New. Bristol: Bristol Classical, 2003.

description: An island located in the Black Sea to the east of the mouth of the Danube River, approximately 35 km from the coast. In antiquity, the island was thought to be sacred to the Greek hero Achilles. The ancient name "White Island" was derived from the presence of white serpents, according to Dionysius Periegetes.
details: The Barrington Atlas Directory notes: Zmeinyi. For Pliny the Elder, the Racecourse of Achilles (Dromos Achilleos) is located some 125 miles from the island, near to the coast of Crimea and close to the mouth of the Dnieper in this place.
